settings.title: Overhead Lift Difficulties
settings.text: Struggle performing exercises like overhead presses, snatches and jerks due to limited range of motion
settings.hidden-text: It doesn't matter if you are PRO or beginner in Olympic weightlifting or Functional Fitness

settings.title: Shoulder Pain & Discomfort
settings.text: Feel discomfort, tightness or instability during the lifts
settings.hidden-text: It doesn't matter if you are PRO or beginner in Olympic weightlifting or Functional Fitness

settings.title: Recurrent Injuries
settings.text: Repetitive shoulder injuries such as strains, impingements, or tears, crucial for long-term joint health
settings.hidden-text: It doesn't matter if you are PRO or beginner in Olympic weightlifting or Functional Fitness

settings.title: Performance Plateaus
settings.text: Poor overhead mobility is blocking potential for increased strength and athletic achievements
settings.hidden-text: It doesn't matter if you are PRO or beginner in Olympic weightlifting or Functional Fitness

settings.question: Who is the mobility routine for lifters best suited for?
settings.answer: This overhead mobility program is best suited for those with very mild to no (0-2) shoulder pain ANYTHING related to overhead shoulder mobility deficits. People that have difficulty with overhead lifts (Functional Fitness & Olympic weightlifters) and individuals that want to improve their overhead mobility and stability!
